sen.j: 長沢芦雪（ながさわ ろせつ、宝暦4年（1754年） - 寛政11年6月8日 (旧暦)（1799年7月10日））は、江戸時代の絵師。
sen.e: Rosetsu NAGASAWA (長沢芦雪) (the date of birth unknown, 1754- July 10, 1799) was a painter in the Edo period.
Rosetsu NAGASAWA (長沢芦雪) (the date of birth unknown, 1754- July 10, 1799) was a painter in the Edo period.
Rosetsu NAGASAWA (長沢芦雪) (the date of birth unknown, 1754- July 10, 1799) was a painter in the Edo period.

sen.j: 円山応挙の高弟。
sen.e: He was a senior disciple of Okyo MARUYAMA.
He was a senior disciple of Okyo MARUYAMA.
He was a senior disciple of Okyo MARUYAMA.

sen.j: 蘆雪とも。
sen.e: His name is also spelt as 蘆雪 (Rosetsu).
His name is also spelt as 蘆雪 (Rosetsu).
His name is also spelt as 蘆雪 (Rosetsu).

sen.j: 名は、政勝、魚。
sen.e: His myo (another name) included Masakatsu and Gyo.
His other names included Masakatsu and Gyo.
sen.cmt: 「名」→名前には諱（本名）や通称などがありましたが、「みょう」という呼び方があったわけではないので、ここでは別名という意味だと思います。
sen.e: His other names included Masakatsu and Gyo.

sen.j: 字は、氷計、引裾。
sen.e: His azana (literary name) was Hyokei and Hikisuso.
His azana (Chinese courtesy name used in place of given name in formal situations; Japanese scholars and literati adopted this custom) were Hyokei and Inkyo.
sen.cmt: 「引裾」は「いんきょ」と読むようです。（http://www.tulips.tsukuba.ac.jp/jart/mokuji//2nsrs001.html)「字」→"literary name"は号、ペンネームのような印象を受けます。用語集には"adult male's nickname""popular name"などがありますが、通称とは少し違うと思いますので、訳が難しいです。（http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn2/3486/m0u/%E5%AD%97/, http://tangorin.com/words/Chinese%20courtesy%20name）
sen.e: His azana (Chinese courtesy name used in place of given name in formal situations; Japanese scholars and literati adopted this custom) were Hyokei and Inkyo.

sen.j: 通称、主計。
sen.e: He was commonly called Shukei.
He was commonly called Kazue.
sen.cmt: 「主計」は、人名では「かずえ」と読むようです。字（あざな）は中国風の音読みが一般的ですが、通称なので日本風の読み方だと思います。
sen.e: He was commonly called Kazue.

sen.j: 芦雪の他、別号に千洲漁者、千緝なども用いた。
sen.e: Besides Rosetsu, he used other noms de plume like Senshu Gyosha or Senshu.
Besides Rosetsu, he used other noms de plume like Ushu Ryoja or Ushu.
sen.cmt: 「千洲漁者」「千緝」→「千」ではなく「于」の字が正しく、「うしゅうりょうじゃ」「うしゅう」と読むようです。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E9%95%B7%E6%B2%A2%E8%98%86%E9%9B%AA, http://www.tulips.tsukuba.ac.jp/jart/mokuji//2nsrs001.html）
sen.e: Besides Rosetsu, he used other noms de plume like Ushu Ryoja or Ushu.

sen.j: 現在の京都市伏見区に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in present Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
He was born in present Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
He was born in present Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 同時代の高名な絵師と比べるとその履歴を示す資料は少なく、いつ応挙の弟子になったかさえはっきりとはわからない。
sen.e: It is unclear even when Rosetsu became Okyo's disciple since his career is much less documented than those of great artists in his times.
It is unclear even when Rosetsu became Okyo's disciple since his career is much less documented than those of great artists in his times.
It is unclear even when Rosetsu became Okyo's disciple since his career is much less documented than those of great artists in his times.

sen.j: 後記の南紀滞在の際に芦雪自身が、自分の父が上杉彦右衛門であると述べたという資料が残っている。
sen.e: As will be mentioned below, however, there remains a document in which Rosetsu told of his father, Hikozaemon UESUGI when he stayed in Nanki.
As will be mentioned below, however, there remains a document in which Rosetsu told of his father, Hikozaemon UESUGI when he stayed in Nanki.
As will be mentioned below, however, there remains a document in which Rosetsu told of his father, Hikozaemon UESUGI when he stayed in Nanki.

sen.j: その性格は奔放で、ある意味快活である一方、傲慢な面があったと伝えられる。
sen.e: Apparently, Rosetsu was bold, cheerful in a sense, but also arrogant.
Apparently, Rosetsu was bold, cheerful in a sense, but also arrogant.
Apparently, Rosetsu was bold, cheerful in a sense, but also arrogant.

sen.j: そのせいか、｢後年応挙に破門された｣というような悪評とも言うべき根拠不明な巷説や異常な行動を伝える逸話は多い。
sen.e: That is probably why there is a groundless gossip or a bad publicity that 'he was later expelled by Okyo' in addition to many anecdotes that recount his perverse behaviors.
That is probably why there is a groundless gossip or a bad publicity that 'he was later expelled by Okyo' in addition to many anecdotes that recount his perverse behaviors.
That is probably why there is a groundless gossip or a bad publicity that 'he was later expelled by Okyo' in addition to many anecdotes that recount his perverse behaviors.

sen.j: その最たるものがその死である。
sen.e: One of such typical anecdotes is about his death.
One of such typical anecdotes is about his death.
One of such typical anecdotes is about his death.

sen.j: 毒殺とも自殺とも言われる。
sen.e: Some say he was murdered by poisoning but others say he killed himself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some say he was murdered by poisoning but others say he killed himself.
Some say he was murdered by poisoning but others say he killed himself.

sen.j: 少なくとも普通の死ではなかったとされてきたが、事実は不明である。
sen.e: To say the least, he did not die a natural death although we do not know what in fact happened.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: To say the least, his death was unusual although we do not know what in fact happened.
sen.cmt: "die a natural death"は「自然死、老衰で死ぬ」意味なので、「普通の死」より意味が狭いと思います。
sen.e: To say the least, his death was unusual although we do not know what in fact happened.

sen.j: その絵は伝えられる性格そのままに、自由奔放、奇抜なものである。
sen.e: His drawings are free-spirited and eccentric like his legendary character.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His drawings are free-spirited and eccentric just like what his character is said to have been.
sen.cmt: "legendary"は「伝説的、有名な」という意味なので、少し大袈裟な気がします。
sen.e: His drawings are free-spirited and eccentric just like what his character is said to have been.

sen.j: 同時代の曽我蕭白、伊藤若冲とともに｢奇想の画家｣と評される(辻惟雄評)。
sen.e: He was described as 'an eccentric painter,' together with his contemporaries like Soak SOGA and Gauche ITO (by Nobuo TSUJI).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He is described as 'an eccentric painter,' together with his contemporaries like Shohaku SOGA and Jakuchu ITO (by Nobuo TSUJI).
sen.cmt: 「曽我蕭白」は「そが しょうはく」、「伊藤若冲」は「いとう じゃくちゅう」と修正しました。時制を現在形に修正しました。
sen.e: He is described as 'an eccentric painter,' together with his contemporaries like Shohaku SOGA and Jakuchu ITO (by Nobuo TSUJI).

sen.j: 「奇想派」などと言われる。
sen.e: These painters are often grouped together as 'the Eccentric School.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These painters are often grouped together as 'the Eccentric School.'
These painters are often grouped together as 'the Eccentric School.'

sen.j: 黒白、大小の極端な対比や、写実を無視した構図など師である応挙の作風から逸脱しており、この傾向は南紀滞在の折の障壁画にはっきり表れている。
sen.e: Considerably diverging from Okyo's, his master's, style using the extreme contrast between black and white, big and small, or compositions that utterly ignore realism, Rosetsu's eccentric tendency manifests itself in the interior mural paintings which he made at Nanki.

Considerably diverging from his master Okyo's style by using the extreme contrast between black and white, big and small, or compositions that utterly ignore realism, Rosetsu's eccentric tendency manifests itself in the interior mural paintings which he made in Nanki.
sen.cmt: "Okyo's, his master's, style"の部分、語順とコンマの使い方等を修正しました。"at Nanki"→"in Nanki"に修正しました。
sen.e: Considerably diverging from his master Okyo's style by using the extreme contrast between black and white, big and small, or compositions that utterly ignore realism, Rosetsu's eccentric tendency manifests itself in the interior mural paintings which he made in Nanki.

sen.j: 作風は基本的に明るく軽快であるが、晩年になって『山姥』のような時折グロテスクで陰惨な印象の作品を残した。
sen.e: While his style was essentially bright and gallant, he occasionally produced grotesque and gruesome drawings like "Yamanba" (A Mountain Witch) in his later years.
While his style was essentially bright and gallant, he occasionally produced grotesque and gruesome drawings like "Yamanba" (A Mountain Witch) in his later years.
While his style was essentially bright and gallant, he occasionally produced grotesque and gruesome drawings like "Yamanba" (A Mountain Witch) in his later years.

sen.j: 1786年-1987年（天明6-7年）、南紀に滞在した折に多くの障壁画を残している。
sen.e: From 1786 to 1787 he composed many interior mural paintings during his stay in Nanki.
sen.cmt: 原文の赤字部分は明らかな誤植なので、旧暦にあわせて変更しました。
sen.e: From 1786 to 1787 he composed many interior mural paintings during his stay in Nanki.
From 1786 to 1787 he composed many interior mural paintings during his stay in Nanki.

sen.j: 現在、串本の無量寺、古座の成就寺、富田の草堂寺に計180面の障壁画が残る。
sen.e: Currently, a total of 180 interior mural paintings by Rosetsu remains in Muryo-ji Temple in Kushimoto, Joju-ji Temple in Koza, and Sodo-ji Temple in Tonda.
Currently, a total of 180 interior mural paintings by Rosetsu remains in Muryo-ji Temple in Kushimoto, Joju-ji Temple in Koza, and Sodo-ji Temple in Tonda.
Currently, a total of 180 interior mural paintings by Rosetsu remains in Muryo-ji Temple in Kushimoto, Joju-ji Temple in Koza, and Sodo-ji Temple in Tonda.

sen.j: 無量寺境内には応挙芦雪館が開設されている。
sen.e: Okyo-Rosetsu Gallery has been established in Muryo-ji Temple.
Okyo-Rosetsu Gallery has been established in Muryo-ji Temple.
Okyo-Rosetsu Gallery has been established in Muryo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 代表作
sen.e: Rosetsu's Well-known Works
Well-known Works
sen.cmt: "Rosetsu's"は原文にない語で、不必要と思われるため、削除しました。
sen.e: Well-known Works

sen.j: 『虎図』（重要文化財）無量寺 串本応挙芦雪館（和歌山県串本町）
sen.e: "Tora-zu" (A Tiger) (important cultural property) Muryo-ji Temple, Kushimoto Okyo Rosetsu Gallery (Kushimoto-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)
"Tora-zu" (A Tiger) (important cultural property) Muryo-ji Temple, Kushimoto Okyo Rosetsu Gallery (Kushimoto-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)
"Tora-zu" (A Tiger) (important cultural property) Muryo-ji Temple, Kushimoto Okyo Rosetsu Gallery (Kushimoto-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)

sen.j: 『竜図』（重要文化財）無量寺 串本応挙芦雪館（和歌山県串本町）
sen.e: "Ryu-zu" (A Dragon) (important cultural property) Muryo-ji Temple, Kushimoto Okyo Rosetsu Gallery (Kushimoto-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)
"Ryu-zu" (A Dragon) (important cultural property) Muryo-ji Temple, Kushimoto Okyo Rosetsu Gallery (Kushimoto-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)
"Ryu-zu" (A Dragon) (important cultural property) Muryo-ji Temple, Kushimoto Okyo Rosetsu Gallery (Kushimoto-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)

sen.j: 『群雀図襖』（重要文化財） 成就寺（和歌山県古座町）
sen.e: "Gun-jaku-zu Fusuma" (A Flock of Sparrows on Sliding Doors" (important cultural property) Joju-ji Temple (Koza-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)
"Gun-jaku-zu Fusuma" (A Flock of Sparrows on Sliding Doors" (important cultural property) Joju-ji Temple (Koza-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)
"Gun-jaku-zu Fusuma" (A Flock of Sparrows on Sliding Doors" (important cultural property) Joju-ji Temple (Koza-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)

sen.j: 『群猿図屏風』（重要文化財）草堂寺（和歌山県白浜町）
sen.e: "Gun-en-zu Byobu" (A Troop of Monkeys on a Folding Screen) (important cultural property) Sodo-ji Temple (Shirahama-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)
"Gun-en-zu Byobu" (A Troop of Monkeys on a Folding Screen) (important cultural property) Sodo-ji Temple (Shirahama-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)
"Gun-en-zu Byobu" (A Troop of Monkeys on a Folding Screen) (important cultural property) Sodo-ji Temple (Shirahama-cho, Wakayama Prefecture)

sen.j: 『紙本水墨寒山拾得図』（重要文化財）高山寺（和歌山県田辺市）
sen.e: "Shihon suiboku Kanzan Jittoku-zu" (Kanzan and Jittoku, ink on paper)(important cultural property) Kozan-ji temple (Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture)
"Shihon Suiboku Kanzan Jittoku-zu" (Kanzan and Jittoku, ink on paper)(important cultural property) Kozan-ji temple (Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 作品名の各語の頭文字を大文字で統一しました。
sen.e: "Shihon Suiboku Kanzan Jittoku-zu" (Kanzan and Jittoku, ink on paper)(important cultural property) Kozan-ji temple (Tanabe City, Wakayama Prefecture)

sen.j: 『猿之間』（重要文化財）大乗寺 (香美町)（兵庫県香美町）
sen.e: "Saru no ma" (Monkey Room) (important cultural property) Daijo-ji Temple (Kami-cho) (Kami-cho, Hyogo Prefecture)
"Saru no Ma" (Monkey Room) (important cultural property) Daijo-ji Temple (Kami-cho, Hyogo Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 寺名の後の(Kami-cho)は、続く（Kami-cho, Hyogo Prefecture)と重なるので削除しました。作品名の各語の頭文字を大文字で統一しました。
sen.e: "Saru no Ma" (Monkey Room) (important cultural property) Daijo-ji Temple (Kami-cho, Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: 『山姥図』（重要文化財）厳島神社（広島県廿日市市）
sen.e: "Yamanba-zu" (A Mountain Witch) (important cultural property) Itsukushima-jinja Shrine (Hatsukaichi City, Hiroshima Prefecture)
"Yamanba-zu" (A Mountain Witch) (important cultural property) Itsukushima-jinja Shrine (Hatsukaichi City, Hiroshima Prefecture)
"Yamanba-zu" (A Mountain Witch) (important cultural property) Itsukushima-jinja Shrine (Hatsukaichi City, Hiroshima Prefecture)

sen.j: 『宮島八景図』（文化庁保管、重要文化財）
sen.e: "Miyajima hakkei-zu" (Eight Famous Views of Miyajima) (held by the Agency for Cultural Affairs, important cultural property)
"Miyajima Hakkei-zu" (Eight Famous Views of Miyajima) (held by the Agency for Cultural Affairs, important cultural property)
sen.cmt: 作品名の各語の頭文字を大文字で統一しました。
sen.e: "Miyajima Hakkei-zu" (Eight Famous Views of Miyajima) (held by the Agency for Cultural Affairs, important cultural property)

sen.j: 『月夜山水図』（重要美術品）頴川美術館（兵庫県西宮市）
sen.e: "Getsuya sansui-zu" (Landscape of a Moonlit Night) (important arts) Egawa Museum of Art (Nishinomiya City, Hyogo Prefecture)
"Getsuya Sansui-zu" (Landscape of a Moonlit Night) (important arts) Egawa Museum of Art (Nishinomiya City, Hyogo Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 作品名の各語の頭文字を大文字で統一しました。
